== Introduction ==
These games can be played on Java Web Start installed Ubuntu and variants or Java enabled browsers.

=== RuneScape ===
<nowiki>[[http://www.runescape.com/|RuneScape]]</nowiki> is a third-person 3D MMORPG with a medieval/fantasy theme.  It works best with an OpenGL-capable video card (e.g. NVIDIA).

* Genre: 3rd person 3D MMORPG
* Homepage: <nowiki>[[http://www.runescape.com/]]</nowiki>

=== Tropic Euro ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; width:50%"><nowiki>[[File:tropiceuro.png|Tropic Euro Screenshot|width="100%"]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:none; vertical-align:top;">Tropic Euro is an online adaptation of the board game <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puerto_Rico_%28board_game%29|Puerto Rico]]</nowiki> by Andreas Seyfarth. The original game supports 3 to 5 players and is based on the island of Puerto Rico during the age of Caribbean ascendancy. Tropic Euro maintains the same game mechanics except has a new theme, set in Europe just after the end of World War II. It also supports the official two-player variant and all of the extra buildings added in the Puerto Rico expansion pack released in 2004. '''Tropic Euro''' can be found at this '''''<nowiki>[[http://www.tropiceuro.com/|link]]</nowiki>'''''
|}

=== Truly Unusual Experience of Revolution (TUER) ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; width:50%"><nowiki>[[File:tuer.png|Truly Unusual Experience of Revolution Screenshot|width="100%"]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:none; vertical-align:top;">The capitalism is leading our world to the its end. The precarity and the unemployment are growing, the nature is dying, the social rights are quickly disappearing like the public utilities. The poverty forces lots of people to live homeless and to steal food. Your mission consist in stopping them and avoiding civilian casualties. If they refuse to surrender, shoot on sight, you have the license to kill. '''TUER''' can be found at this '''''<nowiki>[[http://tuer.sourceforge.net/index.php|link]]</nowiki>'''''.
|}

=== Wurm Online ===
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; width:50%"><nowiki>[[File:wurmonline.png|Wurm Screenshot|width="100%"]]</nowiki>
| <style="border:none; vertical-align:top;">Wurm Online is a fantasy MMORPG developed by Onetoofree AB. In Wurm Online, the player assumes the role of a peasant who chooses their playing style ranging from working alone to being part of a village. The core game-play involves wilderness survival, landscaping and crafting. Conflict may be player-vs-player or player-vs-environment. '''Wurm Online''' can be found at this '''''<nowiki>[[http://www.wurmonline.com/|link]]</nowiki>'''''.
|}
